abstract: AT&T, the country’s second-biggest wireless phone company, agreed Friday to pay $2.35 billion in cash to buy assets put up for auction by Verizon Wireless.
lead_paragraph: AT&T, the country’s second-biggest wireless phone company, agreed Friday to pay $2.35 billion in cash to buy assets put up for auction by Verizon Wireless.

headline.main: AT&T Buys Some Assets From Verizon Wireless
